head.supplied: [ ¶ However, thanks to the kindness of a young lady artist, who has drawn it for me, true to nature, I have now a copy which I shall transmit to Baron Ferdinand Von Mueller, who I am quite sure, will ...

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from a letter from William Webb to the Albany mail and King George's Sound advertiser, 22 July 1884, p. 2. Webb discusses a marine zoophyte that he had found at Emu Point (WA); although new to him, he was not sure that it was undescribed as his 'knowledge of the science of natural history is very limited, as I am only a natural history collector'.

p.seg: However, thanks to the kindness of a young lady artist, who has drawn it for me, true to nature, I have now a copy which I shall transmit to Baron Ferdinand Von Mueller, who I am quite sure, will do me justice.]
